title: help support bereavement
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENTSponsoredHelp and support through bereavementHere are of the best funeral directors that will offer just that and more.Green Willow FuneralsGreen Willows Funeral Home arealways at the heart of the community and the directors of Green Willow Funerals give their expertise, time and governance in a voluntary capacity. Their motivation is to ensure bereaved iniduals and families receive personal, respectful and affordable services and to ensure company profits are donated for charitable purposes.Furthermore, the directors set and promote an ethos and standards to which:The company and its staff will provide a transparent, compassionate service to its clients and the families that it serves.The approach to the client will be client-centred and, at all times, impartial professional advice will be provided, giving the client all options possible.We will enable and support the client and empower them to be the decision maker and, having provided the required information, ensure the client understands why they have made those decisions and that it remains appropriate to their needs.We will maintain professional fees that meet the needs of the company and its commitments and reflect the services provided however, these charges are not purely profit driven and are levied at a rate that provides a cost effective option to the clients and the communities that we serve when they are compared to the charges made by the companyrsquos competitors.All clients, regardless of gender, faith or belief are treated as equals. Green Willow Funerals is also an equal opportunity employer.As a company owned by a Christian and charitable body, the Cardf YMCATrust, the company and its staff aim to maintain and uphold in all matters Christian principles and teachings, althoughtheyare not required to be practising Christians.Phone: Newport |  Website:greenwillowfuneralsPark Funeral DirectorsWe continue to provide professional and respectful funeral services from our independent funeral homes situated in Barry, Vale of Glamorgan. Our establishment has been serving the local community for many years now. Park Funeral Directors are committed to ensuring your lost loved one receives the dignied and heartfelt send-off they deserve.Not to mention, your familyrsquos needs are our top priority, and we go above and beyond to ensure final wishes are met. As an independent, family-run funeral directors, we offer that extra personal touch to make sure the funeral service is as special as you envisage.We will bring your loved one into our care at either our Barry or Penarth site. Here, they will be treated with the utmost dignity and respect until the day of the funeral. Our facilities also offer tasteful and comfortable rest roomsin which you can spend time with the deceased in peace and solitude. Here, you will be able to share final moments of prayer or reflection with the deceased while in a safe and private setting. Our experienced staff will then guide you through the process of arranging the funeral, including sourcing memorials, flowers and stationery.We are committed to fulfilling the final requests of the deceased and their families. Therefore, you can rest assurethat any final requests will be followed to the letter wherever possible. If you have a funeral plan, your wishes will be carried out in accordance with your package.Alternatively, pre-determined requests of the deceased as well as those of the next of kin will be carried out. Our promise to you is that every funeral delivered by Park Funeral Directors will be conducted with the utmost in dignity and respect at all times.Phone:Barry |    Penarth |   Email:barry@parkfuneralsWebsite:parkfuneralsBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENT s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: st athan railway station considered
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityVale of Glamorgan Council has commissioned a consultancy firm to investigate the possibility of creating a railway station in St Athan.In the past there were two train stations based near the village Gileston and St Athan Road, but these are closed. A third railway station, named St Athan despite being three kilometres to the west of the village near Boverton also no longer operates.But with the Vale of Glamorgan Line reopening in  and new stations located at nearby Llantwit Major and Rhoose Cardf International Airport, the Council wants to explore whether there is an opportunity to re-establish a station near St Athan.Consultants Arcadis will look at an area around a section of the B, Barry to Llantwit Major Road, to determinea suitable site exists.They will consider many factors, including:Those relating to environmental featuresLand informationPlanning constraintsStation requirements, such as vehicle, pedestrian, and cycle accessCllr John Thomas, Vale of Glamorgan Council Ward Member for St Athan, said:ldquoIrsquom delighted that we are looking into the possibility of locating a railway station at St Athan."It has been a long time since one existed in the village and with the local population growing it is sensible that we look into expanding public transport services.Cllr Peter King, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood services and Transport, added:ldquoI understand the appetite for a railway station in St Athan so we have commissioned consultants to determine whether such a move is feasible.ldquoIncreasing the use of public transport is in keeping with the Councilrsquos Project Zero initiative to reduce carbon emissions so this is something we are very interested in investigating.Once Arcadis have completed the study, their findings will be reported, and the Council will consider whether to take the matter forward. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: wales vs south africa autumn nations match   stream watch tv
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe hosts take on World Champions South Africa just seven days after their - defeat to New Zealand.However, unlike in that game, recent history favours Wales when it comes to South Africa.Wales have toppled the Springboks four times in a row at home, with South Africa last departing the Welsh capital victorious eight years ago.Credit: PAldquoWe are always trying to develop our game, said centre Davies, who took over captaincy duties when Alun Wyn Jones went off injured after just  minutes of the New Zealand encounter.ldquoThe one thing this team always shows is that the more time we spend together, the better we get.ldquoWe will dust ourselves off, come in on Monday and look to build and get a result next week at home.ldquoItrsquos the fine details ndash not moving forward on kicks, executing our exits correctly and not putting pressure on ourselves.Credit: PAldquoThe way South Africa play, they want to put pressure on you. For us, itrsquos making sure we build and play in the right areas of the field.ldquoLook, you work extremely hard to get a result, and when you donrsquot get it, it does hurt.ldquoThe beauty of it now is we have another opportunity next week to put the wrongs right. That is what this group will want to show next week.How to watch Wales vs South AfricaThe only way to watch Wales vs South Africa live this year is with Amazon Prime Video.The streaming service secured a new deal to exclusively broadcast Walesrsquo autumn games.All teams, except for Ireland who will be broadcast on Channel , will have their games shown behind the paywall.Amazon Prime costs pound. per month.Credit: PAUsually, Walesrsquo games would also be shown live on SC, however, with Amazon offering a Welsh language service, there will be no live coverage on the free-to-air channel..removeHighlights of all Wales matches will be shown on the evening of the test, with the South Africa highlights starting at .pm on Saturday.Walesrsquo Autumn Nations Series fixturesWales  -  New ZealandWales v South Africa, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Fiji, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Australia, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime Video article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: new building replace bowling pavilion belle vue park
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitynew" New community building in Penarth park to get ‘hundreds of users a week’old" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA NEW community building in a Penarth park is set to get hundreds of users a week, according to council bosses.The new building will replace the current bowling pavilion in Belle Vue Park, in Albert Crescent.Vale of Glamorgan councilrsquos planning committee approved permission for the replacement building last week.Councillor Kathryn McCaffer, cabinet member for leisure, arts and culture, said: ldquoThe new building will encourage a wide range of community groups to be able to use the space. Anyone who has attended a meeting or event in the current building can attest to how uninviting and inaccessible it is, and freezing cold.ldquoWhile itrsquos sad that the existing, dilapidated building needs to be demolished, it has had a long le which has mainly benefited the bowling club."I welcome the building of a new pavilion as a way to ensure the whole community is supported for future generations, so we can keep adding to the history of this location.David Knevett, operational manager for leisure and tourism, did not answer questions on the cost of the works, but expects hundreds of users each week.He said: ldquoThe new building is a considerable investment, and leisure services are keen that itrsquos used to its full potential. By combining community use, the use of the bowlers, and events, we are confident this can be achieved.ldquoWe feel the building provides a springboard for more community activity to take place in this area of Penarth. Wersquore really excited about this project and the opportunity this building will represent."A signicant amount of the cost is being funded through Section , and wersquove been fortunate enough to secure a grant from the lottery for this building.The new community building was welcomed by a local community group, Friends of Belle Vue, who took part in public consultations and fed into the final designs.The Friends Theo Hodgkinson said: ldquoWersquore really excited to see the positive impacts of having a purpose-built facility that is accessible to all age groups. Wersquore also excited about the energy-saving credentials of the building." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: gannett foundation cash charities motion control dance
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMotion Control Dance caters to all ages and abilities lt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance is based in YMCA Barry " Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance has been serving the community for two decades lt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance caters to people all across the Vale of Glamorgan lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance aims to keep people healthy and avoid them feeling isolatedltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance was given charity status in  lt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentYOUR favourite local paper is giving local charities the chance to take a share of a whopping poundk cash giveaway.Our parent companyrsquos charitable arm, The Gannett Foundation, is providing pound, in cash to support local charities across the country - and we are delighted to have a pound, share to give away in our area.And we asked YOU to decide where this money should be spent. You nominated in your thousands and our editorial team chose a shortlist of eight charities from these nominations that will share in the pound,.In Wales the shortlist is:Motion Control DanceSparkleHelping Caring TeamWish Upon a StarPhoenix Bereavement SupportEthos - Extending The Hand Of Support .Chard  District MuseumSt Giles Animal RescueMotion Control Dance, based in the Vale of Glamorgan, was set-up by dance tutor Emma Mallam and aims to enrich the lives of people through movement." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance caters to people all across the Vale of Glamorgan " class"editor-image"She was teaching dance in England when her husband was diagnosed with a terminal brain tumor and the couple ed to Wales.ldquoI set up dance classes to keep myself busy, said Ms Mallam.ldquoI wanted to make a dference through movement as I watched my husband deteriorate and helped him by doing exercises and dancing with him to keep up his spirits.She sadly lost her husband in  and, along with looking after her baby, created a fulltime job doing giving people a ldquoChance  Dance.In  she became the dance development officer for the Vale with Vibe Experience and in  ndash addressing a lack of disability dancing provisions in the Vale ndash Local Motion Dance was introduced." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance was given charity status in  " class"editor-image"ldquoThis made us unique as we focused on community dance - using dance to help expression, confidence, self-esteem and to reduce isolation - rather than focus on exams and technical development, said Ms Mallam.Motion Control Dance - which gained charity status in  and is based at a studio in the YMCA Hub in Barry - caters to all ages and abilities, including older people. It caters for those with dementia, Parkinsonrsquos, the disabled, and mainstream groups..removeOver the past two decades they have worked with more than , iniduals each year, working in partnership with the Vale of Glamorgan Council and The Vale Youth Service, and delivering dance workshops." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance aims to keep people healthy and avoid them feeling isolated " class"editor-image"ldquoI am delighted how far Motion Control Dance has come, added Ms Mallam.ldquoWe have a team of experienced dance tutors who nurture the personal and social growth of our members.ldquoWe have employed two young people to undertake social media and administration and are training four young dance leaders to lead sessions - we want to provide opportunities for young people.ldquoWe also offer movement sessions for adults and older people this increased our mission to tackle social isolation in the community and give everyone a Chance to Dance.ldquoThe end of  saw our room be transformed into a fully equipped dance studio with a new sprung floor ensuring we are enriching lives through movement. Motion Control Dance is now thriving in our community.She is ldquoabsolutely thrilled to be one of eight chosen Welsh charities and has thanked the community." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance is based in YMCA Barry " class"editor-image"Money would help Motion Control Dance recover their services for older people in the Vale during the Covid pandemic classes went virtual.ldquoWe built a busy programme in , but since Covid we have been unable to run our full programme indoors at our studio or at care homes and community centres, said Ms Mallam.ldquoMany vulnerable adults and older people requiring care are continuing to self-isolate or are too fearful to attend indoor activity to be responsive to a iety of restrictions imposed we need financial support, so we can deliver an accessible movement programme for older people which can be taken to people and adaptive to their needs.ldquoOur goal is to reduce social isolation and prevent more costly health and social care needs by improving the health and wellbeing of iniduals through access to regular physical, creative and social activity." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance has been serving the community for two decades " class"editor-image"Now we are putting the power to allocate the cash back into the hands of our readers ndash during November, you are invited to collect tokens from our newspapers which can then be sent to collection points across our region or posted.Each token collected will then be used to allocate cash to the nominated charity - soyour favourite charity collects  per cent of all the tokens collected, it will receive  per cent of the pound,.Collection points are at:WH Smith, Windsor Road, PenarthTown News Xtra, Holton Road, BarryMCD Studio, YMCA Hub, Court Road, Barry. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - title: wales mps making thousands extra cash
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe most recent parliamentary Register of Members Interests shows that MPs accepted tickets to sporting and music events worth hundreds of pounds, while others engaged in highly paid consultancy work for global firms.Since April , the basic pay for a Member of Parliament has been pound, per year. On top of this, MPs are permitted to make expense claims for their commute between Parliament and their constituency.They also receive heavily discounted food and drink at parliament, subsidised by public money.Yet many MPs in Wales continue to accept lucrative work from private companies alongside their role as an elected representative, hold shares in private companies, and accept valuable gts.Perhaps the most high profile example this past year was Alun Cairns, MP for the Vale of Glamorgan, and Secretary of State for Wales before his  resignation over an aidersquos involvement in the sabotage of a rape trial.:Disgraced Rob Roberts is given back Tory membershipMr Cairns accepted consultancy roles at BBI Group, a Caerphilly-based ldquoglobal le science and diagnostic company and at Veezu Holdings Ltd, a Newport-basedldquoprivate hire transport and technology  which owns Dragon Taxis, last year.BBI Group is a partner on the UK governmentrsquos Rapid Test Consortium and was contracted to provide lateral flow Covid- antibody tests in October .Mr Cairns earns approximately pound per hour for his work ldquoproviding strategic advice to the Board at the firm, totalling pound, per year on top of his MP salary. He makes the same amount for his role at Veezu. has three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. " alt"Penarth Times: Alun Cairnshas three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. " class"editor-image"Alun Cairnshas three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. This year Mr Cairns also accepted employment at Singapore-based asset management company Elite Partners Capital, which owns a number of UK commercial properties rented out by the government..remove:Jane Dodds MS says a UBI needs ambition to become a realityOn its website the company boasts: ldquoEighty-five percent of the assets are based in town centre locations and are core locations occupied by UK Government.ldquoSecured top grade tenant with over % of the income secured by the UK Government.Mr Cairns sits on the All Party Parliamentary Group on Singapore, which aims to ldquopromote and advance relations with Singapore. He earns approximately pound per hour in his role as a strategic consultant for Elite Partners Capital, adding up to pound, a year.Cairns also sits on the APPGs for Taxis and Financial Markets and Services.This Govt should always be there to support those who need help but the days of blank cheque benefits are over. #welfarepartymdash Alun CairnsJuly , A tweet by Mr Cairns from  reads: ldquoThis Govt should always be there to support those who need help but the days of blank cheque benefits are over. #welfarepartyldquoAll [my] roles have been scrutinised and approved by Parliamentrsquos independent advisory body, ACOBA, he told The Nationaltoday.Many of Mr Cairnsrsquo Welsh Conservative colleagues also registered extra income streams.:Westminster is in effect a free-for-allVale of Clwyd MP Dr James Davies, who practiced as a GP before entering Parliament, has, the parliamentary Register of Membersrsquo Interests shows, continued to work occasional shts - including NHS out of hours work.But while former Cabinet Minister Cairns is able to collect a pound, salary for  hoursrsquo work, Dr Davies had to put in  hours as a GP ndash spread over  months ndash to earn around the same amount." alt"Penarth Times: Dr James Davies, MP for Vale of Clwyd, made more than poundk working as a GP and received pound, from telecomms company IX Wireless " class"editor-image"Dr James Davies, MP for Vale of Clwyd, made more than poundk working as a GP and received pound, from telecomms company IX Wireless Current Welsh Secretary Simon Hart accepted pound, from Landsker Business Club this February. The Club is registered as an "unincorporated association" such groups are able to direct signicant funds to politicians without disclosing the identities of their members. The practice is legal.Hart received a further pound, from hwe Ltd, a strategic comms company.:Wales can lead the way on electoral reformThis past year Virginia Crosbie, Conservative MP for Ynys Mocircn, accepted pound, in donations from the Cayzer Trust, which manages the commercial interests of the billionaire Cayzer family. The trust owns controlling shares of financial giant Caledonia Investments.Crosbie also received a pound, donation in-kind from trust fund manager and Conservative stalwart Patrick Evershed in May this year. The money was received indirectly through a Conservative Party organisation." alt"Penarth Times: Ynys Mon MP Virginia Crosbie was elected in . " class"editor-image"Ynys Mon MP Virginia Crosbie was elected in . Mr Evershed is the president of the Cities of London and Westminster Conservative Association, and has previously told interviewers that he owns a cottage in north Wales.In all, Virginia Crosbie registered gts worth pound, over the past year. She also earnedpound, completing surveys for companies YouGov, Ipsos MORI and Yonder but all of those fees were paid directly to charity.She said, via email: ldquoI regularly receive donations and I use the money for the benefit of my constituents.ldquoFor example, I used one donation to pay for the distribution of a leaflet across the island on mental health. Other future initiatives in a similar vein will also use donations.ldquoI make no apology for using this money to help all my constituents on Anglesey.:What will the census show us about the state of Welsh This week both Ms Crosbie and Alun Cairns voted in favour of throwing out the current parliamentary standards watchdog, which investigates rule breaches and conflicts of interest, after the body recommended the suspension of MP Owen Paterson. Westminster later u-turned on the decision.MP for Bridgend Jamie Wallis receives more than pound, per year in rent from commercial properties in Bridgend. He also holds signicant shares in sixteen dferent companies, some worth thousands of pounds.Mr Wallis said:ldquoFollowing my election as the MP for Bridgend I resigned all my Company Directorships. Media, music and Clement AttleeA handful of Welsh MPs earn additional income from writing articles and books, while one even earned extra cash for performing in a rock band." alt"Penarth Times: Chris Bryant chairs the committee which found MP Owen Paterson had engaged in lobbying on behalf of companies that were paying him. " class"editor-image"Chris Bryant chairs the committee which found MP Owen Paterson had engaged in lobbying on behalf of companies that were paying him. Chris Bryant, Rhondda MP and Chair of the Parliamentary Standards Committee, has authored a number of books and also regularly contributes articles to publications such as The Daily , Theand Attitude.In addition to his MP salary, the Labour member earned an extra pound, , with fees ranging from pound for three hours presenting an LBC radio programme to pound, for the film rights to his book, The Glamour Boys.Bryant also picked up pound, in March for giving a talk on his book at an LGBTQ+ webinar organised by American investment bank Goldman Sachs.:Festival marks  Chartist Newport Rising anniversaryShadow Home Secretary and Torfaen MP Nick Thomas Symonds registered pound,. in additional income, with pound, apparently for legal services provided before entering parliament in .The remainder was made up of royalties for biographies that the former Oxford lecturer had written on Nye Bevan and Clement Attlee before entering parliament.According to his website, the Torfaen MP is currently working on his third book ndash a biography of former Labour PM Harold Wilson.Meanwhile, Kevin Brennan, MP for Cardf West, was paid pound. last November for a performance with his band ldquoMP at television writer Matt Fordersquos  Christmas Special stage show in London." alt"Penarth Times: MP Kevin Brennan released an album called Cross Party with his band of fellow MPs in . " class"editor-image"MP Kevin Brennan released an album called Cross Party with his band of fellow MPs in . Described as ldquothe worldrsquos only parliamentary rock band, MP consists of guitarist Brennan, SNP MP Pete Wishart on keyboards, Conservative and lead singer Sir Greg Knight, and former Labour MP Ian Cawsey.New Pontypridd MP Alex Davies-Jones, who sits on the APPGs for Music Education and Media, accepted Brit Awards tickets and hospitality worth pound from Google, as well as a pound ticket to the Ivor Novello music awards from the Betting and Gaming Council.Similarly, Jo Stevens, Cardf Central MP and Shadow Culture, Media and Sport Secretary, accepted nearly pound, in sporting event and music award tickets.:Starmers private sector optimism is out of dateSome Labour MPs also earned thousands completing surveys. Mark Tami, MP for Alyn and Deeside, earned more than pound, in a matter of months.And the rest Not all MPs reported extra income streams.One such MP, Cynon Valleyrsquos Beth Winter, told The National: ldquoBeing the MP for Cynon Valley is a great privilege. It is also a very time consuming and extremely well paid job.ldquoI fail to understand why any of my colleagues should feel the need to do second jobs, or where they find the time.ldquoMPs should be focused on serving their constituents, not lining their own pockets working for big business. Second jobs for MPs must be banned." alt"Penarth Times: Labour MP Beth Winter says second jobs for MPs should be banned, " class"editor-image"Labour MP Beth Winter says second jobs for MPs should be banned, Plaid Cymru MP for Ceredigion, Ben Lake, added: ldquoI find that my duties as an MP keep me busy enough, and so have never sought [extra income].Other MPs reporting no additional financial interests included Preseli and Pembrokeshire MP Stephen Crabb, Newport East MP Jessica Morden, Aberconwy MP Robin Millar and Arfon MP Hywel Williams.All named MPswere approached for comment.If you valueThe Nationalsjournalism, help grow our team of reporters bybecoming a subscriber.Are you sure you want to delete this comment Yes, delete the commentNo, keep the commentReport This CommentGet involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: three lifeboat launches one afternoon cardiff bay
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityLeboat crews helped a yacht that had run aground" Leboat volunteers have busy Saturday with three launches in one afternoonA fishing vessel was towed in to Cardf Bay by a leboat" Leboat volunteers have busy Saturday with three launches in one afternoonIt was a busy day for volunteers at the RNLI" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentLIFEBOATS were launched three times in one afternoon after sailors experienced some trouble near Cardf Bay.Volunteer RNLIcrews responded to the calls for help on Saturday, November .The first call came in at pm, with a  foot yacht running aground at low tide.A D-class leboat approached and ensured all four people on the yacht were safe, before securing the boats anchor and ing to their station.The leboat ed later on as the yacht refloated as the tiderose to ensure the wellbeing of all people on the boat and to provide assistancenecessary.At .pm, a fishing boat broke down and Milford Haven Coastguard requested that leboat crews attend.The crew were almost finished for the day after washing down the boat and gathering their things to go home.Nevertheless, they attended the scene in anAtlantic  leboat.The fishing vesselhad begun to drt out before droppingits anchor.It was towed in to Cardf Bay by the leboat crew. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: need know penarth remembrance parade
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityNovember  marks Remembrance Sunday  ndash a day to commemorate the service and sacrice of all those that have defended our freedoms.The parade will form at Penarth station approach at .am with the march from am.A spokeswoman for Penarthrsquos Remembrance committee ndash a group of current or ex-military personnel who volunteer ndash said: ldquoIt has been a dficult two years for this important parade, but this year we are back.ldquolsquoWe will remember Themrsquo and we will pass on the history of dedication and sacrice to our future generations.ldquoAlbert Road school are contributing to Remembrance by displaying some of their own work at Penarth pier pavilion, Stanwell school are helping to decorate the pavilion, and Victoria school will be painting and displaying pebbles in the Garden of Remembrance on Rectory Road.ldquoWe have volunteers collecting for the Royal British Legion at Tesco in Penarth and Morrisonrsquos in the Bay.Is anyone is interested in volunteering they can e-mail taffg@hotmail and donations can also be made online at britishlegion.org.ukThe route:Penarth Remembrance Parade  routeThe spokeswoman added: ldquoPenarthrsquos Remembrance committee would like to thank everyone for their support and invite all attendees of the parade to a free buffet at the Penarth ex Servicemanrsquos club on Windsor Road on November . article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: station pub knocked replaced flats
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Station, Windsor Road, Penarth " Popular Penarth pub to be knocked down and replaced with four storeys of flatsHow the apartments at the Station, Windsor Road, could look lt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA popular pub in Penarth is due to be knocked down and replaced with four storeys of flats.The Station, on Windsor Road in Cogan, closed in summer last year as Brains sold the site.Developers are now planning to demolish the building and build  apartments there.Vale of Glamorgan council received an application from Top House Developments for planning permission for the project last month.The building would likely have a cafe on the ground floor, while all the apartments would be classed as lsquoaffordablersquo.In planning documents, developers said: ldquoItrsquos Top House Developmentsrsquo intention to provide a high quality residential development, which respects the local character of the area, and integrates well with the wider streetscene, while also creating an attractive retail frontage at the ground floor of the building.ldquoThe building that is currently on site is vacant, and has been for some time therefore the site has great potential for a residential development.OTHER NEWS:The Station pub was previously run by the Rees family, who took over in April . They previously told reporters it was ldquoheartbreaking to have to leave the pub in July last year.More details about the plans can be found on the Vale council website. Council planners have not yet decided whether to grant permission for the scheme. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: covid pass scheme extended wales including cinemas
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Passes are already required to be shown by anyone who attends a nightclub or a large event like a major sports match.When the scheme was launched a few weeks ago, the initial vote was carried out amid chaotic scenes, with one member - who was trying to vote remotely while attending the Conservative Party conference - unable to cast his ballot.By comparison, todays vote on extending the scheme was a more sedate affair, and passed mainly becausePlaid Cymru members - who had opposed the governments handling of the original proposals - this time voted in favour.The Senedd voted by  members to  to extend the scheme. There were no abstentions.But despite the more straightforward nature of todays vote, there were still criticisms in the Senedd from members who opposed the Covid Pass scheme.Darren Millar, of the Welsh Conservatives,said his party had warned the scheme "would set a dangerous precedent, and it gives me no pleasure today to say that we were right".He added: "Vaccine passports are not a route out of restrictions, they are restrictions. They should not be expanded into other premises when they should never have been introduced or put on the table in the first place."Vaccine passports are coercive, ineffective and anti-business they limit our freedoms but they do not limit the spread of Covid-."Welsh Liberal Democrat leader Jane Dodds was also opposed to extending the scheme. Her party has long criticisedCovid Passes, and she said today the government had "failed to produce the evidence to prove that they are working".But there were many members who spoke in favour of the scheme, includingLabour MS Joyce Watson, who said her constituents had reported feeling safer since the Covid Pass scheme was introduced."If everyone at a venue is either vaccinated or Covid-negative, then it has to be safer for all of us to go there," she told the Senedd. "Thats what people are telling memdashpeople that wont normally go out are saying to me, Actually, we will feel safer now..remove"Theyre good for businesses as wellmdashnot something Ive actually heard you saymdashbecause the disease destroys economic confidence."But its not a cure. The vaccine passport does actually mean that it will be a cure for businesses, because people will have confidence in those businesses to go to those businesses. So, without these measures, fewer people will attend those venues, fewer people will attend those events, certainly the people that speak to me."After the vote, health minister Eluned Morgan said the Covid Pass scheme had produced positive feedback from businesses and event organisers.ldquoI am pleased the extension has been agreed today following the vote," she added. "Covid has not gone away and cases remain high and we need to continue take steps to Keep Wales Safe. The NHS CovidPass is one measure among many to help to keep businesses open while also helping to control the spread of the virus.ldquoThe decision to introduce them has not been taken lightly and the venues that will be covered are indoors and see large numbers of people being closely together for prolonged periods of time."The new rules will be in force from Monday, November . article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: #comments anchor
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Passes are already required to be shown by anyone who attends a nightclub or a large event like a major sports match.When the scheme was launched a few weeks ago, the initial vote was carried out amid chaotic scenes, with one member - who was trying to vote remotely while attending the Conservative Party conference - unable to cast his ballot.By comparison, todays vote on extending the scheme was a more sedate affair, and passed mainly becausePlaid Cymru members - who had opposed the governments handling of the original proposals - this time voted in favour.The Senedd voted by  members to  to extend the scheme. There were no abstentions.But despite the more straightforward nature of todays vote, there were still criticisms in the Senedd from members who opposed the Covid Pass scheme.Darren Millar, of the Welsh Conservatives,said his party had warned the scheme "would set a dangerous precedent, and it gives me no pleasure today to say that we were right".He added: "Vaccine passports are not a route out of restrictions, they are restrictions. They should not be expanded into other premises when they should never have been introduced or put on the table in the first place."Vaccine passports are coercive, ineffective and anti-business they limit our freedoms but they do not limit the spread of Covid-."Welsh Liberal Democrat leader Jane Dodds was also opposed to extending the scheme. Her party has long criticisedCovid Passes, and she said today the government had "failed to produce the evidence to prove that they are working".But there were many members who spoke in favour of the scheme, includingLabour MS Joyce Watson, who said her constituents had reported feeling safer since the Covid Pass scheme was introduced."If everyone at a venue is either vaccinated or Covid-negative, then it has to be safer for all of us to go there," she told the Senedd. "Thats what people are telling memdashpeople that wont normally go out are saying to me, Actually, we will feel safer now..remove"Theyre good for businesses as wellmdashnot something Ive actually heard you saymdashbecause the disease destroys economic confidence."But its not a cure. The vaccine passport does actually mean that it will be a cure for businesses, because people will have confidence in those businesses to go to those businesses. So, without these measures, fewer people will attend those venues, fewer people will attend those events, certainly the people that speak to me."After the vote, health minister Eluned Morgan said the Covid Pass scheme had produced positive feedback from businesses and event organisers.ldquoI am pleased the extension has been agreed today following the vote," she added. "Covid has not gone away and cases remain high and we need to continue take steps to Keep Wales Safe. The NHS CovidPass is one measure among many to help to keep businesses open while also helping to control the spread of the virus.ldquoThe decision to introduce them has not been taken lightly and the venues that will be covered are indoors and see large numbers of people being closely together for prolonged periods of time."The new rules will be in force from Monday, November . article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentsComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. doing it the same way that we would wantwe were employees of it, right ndash so to treat people the way you want to be treated.ldquoThat is always how Irsquove moved.Sorkin also asked Meghan how she is feeling, saying: ldquoAre you feeling just better about everything Meghan replied: ldquoYes, I am feeling much better about everything, thank you..push,i[r].l*new title: aldi offering courses help babies sleep
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia, will start making infant sleeping courses affordable for all UK families.Part of its Specialbuy range, in partnership with Just Chill Baby Sleep, Aldi will help to establish healthy sleep routines for parents and their children.Online courses will start from as little as pound. This is a % discount on standard rates across all sleep courses.Parents can choose from four informative courses that cater for new-borns to four-year-olds:Foundations of Sleep: - months.Practical advice on how to navigate the first few months with a new baby, helping to lay solid sleep foundations and understand their sleep habits: pound. .Sleep Success: - months.Help with nap and bedtime challenge and understanding your babyrsquos sleep needs to help them sleep peacefully and achieve a better sleep quality: pound .Sleep Success: - months.Advice on how to successfully navigate nap times, bedtime and approach nighttime wakingrsquos for a better quality sleep: pound .Sleep Success:  months to  years.Understand a childrsquos sleep needs, including when and how to successfully transition them from a cot to a bed, allowing them to sleep happily in their own space: pound .Rosey Davidson, Infant Sleep Consultant and Founder of Just Chill Baby Sleep, says: ldquoIrsquom so excited that Just Chill Baby Sleep is partnering with Aldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia."For so many parents the cost of in-person sleep support is out of reach, which is why we created our online courses and why this partnership means so much."To be able to offer our courses at a massive % discount and reach even more parents in need is fantastic, and wersquore looking forward to helping new parents and their little ones get the best night sleep possible..remove" alt"Penarth Times: Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound " class"editor-image"Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound Here to offer some advice, Rosey has put together a parental checklist for bedtime which she has shared exclusively with Mamia, to give parents a helping hand at what can be the most dficult time of the day:Have a regular, predictable routineHaving a good balance of sleep in the day can really help your baby to sleep well at night. While all babies are dferent, it can be helpful to think about working towards a routine by doing the same things in the same order each night so that baby learns what is coming next.Think about your little onersquos sleep environmentIt can be helpful to black out bedrooms, something that can be especially important in the summer months. Temperature is also important the Lullaby Trust, the baby sleep charity, say that the safest temperature for our little ones is - degrees celsius.Looking at how your little one falls asleep can help them get a more settled nightIt is very normal for your little one to be fed, rocked or cuddled to sleep, however this can be dficult to maintain. Practice other ways of getting your baby to sleep in their own sleep space to help find a method that suits you, your baby and your parenting style.Watch out for signs of tirednessWhile there are typical s of time that babies will happily stay awake for, the most important thing is getting to know your baby. By observing your baby, you can try to get them down for naps during the day before they get overtired. It is also important not to try to force naps when they are under tired.Fresh air and exerciseGetting out of the house for a bit will blow the cobwebs away and help your little one to burn off some energy. Inside the home your little one will also benefit from lots of time on the floor to keep them moving, while for small babies practising a bit of tummy time can be really helpful.Donrsquot always rush inhellipSometimes your little one will babble or make noise while they are asleep, and by going in too quickly we can disturb them. Equally they can sometimes wake and be happy in their sleep space. If your little one doesnrsquot need your assistance it is important to give them the space to get themselves back to sleep independently.Take care of yourself and donrsquot be afraid to ask for helpTherersquos no shame in not being able to do it all, all of the time. Being sleep deprived can be incredibly challenging and feel very lonely. Please know that is very normal for sleep to be dficult, especially in those early days. Please remember being a parent doesnrsquot always feel easy, because itrsquos not! You are doing a great job.To book a course or find out more, visit the Aldi website.Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityITV has announced the new serieshosted by Ant and Dec willon Sunday, November .Confirmed: Im A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here! starts Sunday  November at pm on ITV.@itv @antanddec @imacelebrity #ImACeleb pic zpleOJBBHRmdash ITV Press CentreNovember , This yearrsquos show will once again be filmed from the historic Gwrych Castle, Abergele in North Wales.Winning the show can often lead to greater fame with lucrative deals and business deals up for grabs for the lucky winner making every dreaded Bushtucker Trial worth it.However, le is not always plain sailing for Jungle castle royalty after ing to normality.Here we take a look at every previous winner of the hit ITV show and find out what theyrsquore up to now.Tony Blackburn -" alt"Penarth Times: Tony Blackburn was the first Im A Celebrity winner. " class"editor-image"Tony Blackburn was the first Im A Celebrity winner. The show made its debut in  with a host of famous celebs including Tara Palmer-Tomkinson, Uri Geller and Christine Hamilton.It was -year-old radio DJ Tony Blackburn who captured the hearts of the nation and was crowned King of the jungle.After leaving the show he continued to have an impressive broadcasting career with the BBC until a brief hiatus in  before ing to be a regular on BBC Radio Two.He is now retired at the age of .Phil Tufnell - " alt"Penarth Times: Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell won the show in . " class"editor-image"Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell won the show in . Former England cricketer Phil Tufnell announced his retirement from the sport shortly before being named as a contestant on the second series of Irsquom A Celeb.His quick wit made him a hit with viewers and the second winner on the show has gone on to become a TV regular.He became a team captain on They Think Itrsquos all over in  before landing his most popular role as team captain on BBCrsquos A Question Of Sport.Phil made it to week nine on the  series of Strictly Come Dancing and appeared on Channel s The Jump..removeHe can still be seen in the small screen today, most recently his golf Netflix show, This Could Go Anywhere.Kerry Katona - " alt"Penarth Times: Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in . " class"editor-image"Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in . Kerry Katona became the first Queen of the jungle in  after winning the first of two series that year.Since leaving the jungle Kerry has been in the headlines for a number of reason. She has had a string of relationships in the public eye, including the public break up former husband Brian McFadden.She was inundated with TV offers as she became the face of Iceland and starred in her own reality TV show. She has also appeared on Celebrity Big Brother and Dancing on Ice.Away from our screens the former Atomic Kitten star has recovered from bankruptcy twice, battled drug and alcohol problems and been diagnosed with bipolar disorder.She now creates content for online  OnlyFans among other things.Joe Pasquale - Irsquom A Celeb ed for a second series in .Comedian Joe Pasquale beat off fierce competition from a host of famous faces including former royal butler Paul Burrell, Janet Street Porter and Vic Reeves.After leaving he continued a string of comedy tours and appeared on the  season of Dancing in Ice ing a year later for the showrsquos all-stars season.He still makes the occasional TV appearance, most recently The Nightly Show in .Carol Thatcher - The daughter of former Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher, Carol was a journalist and author before heading to the jungle.She won over viewers with her no-nonsense approach to Bushtucker Trialrsquos.She went on to become a regular on The One Show before being dropped by the BBC after referring to a Tennis player as a ldquogolliwog in an off-camera discussion with Adrian Chiles and Jo Brand.She wrote a book about growing up as the PMrsquos daughter and her motherrsquos battle with dementia.Matt Willis - " alt"Penarth Times: Matt Willis and his we, tv presenter Emma Willis. " class"editor-image"Matt Willis and his we, tv presenter Emma Willis. Busted musician Matt Willis appeared in the  intsalment of the show alongside famous faces including Myleene Klass, Jason Donovan and Dean Gaffney.Hehad already found solo success after leaving Busted before joining the show but turned his attention to TV after winning the crown.Matt hosted the Irsquom A Celeb spin-off show Irsquom A Celebrity: Extra Camp alongside then girlfriend Emma Grfiths for the  series.He has enjoyed a number of acting roles including in the revival of Birds of a Feather and a brief spell on Eastenders, playing the role of Luke Riley.He has since appeared on stage, including roles in Wicked and Footloose.He now has three children with girlfriend Emma, Isabelle, , Ace, eight, and Trixie, four.Christopher Biggins - " alt"Penarth Times: Christopher Biggins beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson. " class"editor-image"Christopher Biggins beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson. The veteran actor was already a household name famous for roles in shows such as Upstairs, Downstairs and Porridge.He beat off competition from Gemma Atkinson and Janice Dickinson to claim the title of King of the jungle.He went on to appear in a number of celebrity shows including Come Dine With Me and Masterchef.In  he was booted off Celebrity Big Brother after a number of ldquooffensive outbursts that werenrsquot shown on TV.Joe Swash - " alt"Penarth Times: Joe Swash made it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef. " class"editor-image"Joe Swash made it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef. The former Eastenders star won the eighthseries of the show in .Since leaving the show Swash hosted Extra Camp for nearly a decade alongside stars such as Caroline Flack and his now fiance Stacey Solomon.More recently he has appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox and won Dancing on Ice at the start of , before making it to the final of this yearrsquos Celebrity MasterChef.He welcomed his second child, Rose Opal Esme Solomon-Swash, with Stacey Solomon after welcoming their son, Rex, in .The pair got engaged last Christmas but delayed their wedding after she announced her pregnancy in June.Gino DrsquoAcampo - " alt"Penarth Times: Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. " class"editor-image"Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. Celebrity chef Gino won the  series despite controversy.After leaving the jungle both he and co-star Stuart Manning faced animal cruelty charges for killing and cooking a rat during the show.The charges were later dropped when ITV took responsibility and paid a pound, fine.Gino is now regular on This Morning and Celebrity Juice. He also presents ITVs Family Fortunes.He can also be seen travelling the world with fellow chef Gordon Ramsay and First dates restaurant manager Fred Serieix in Gordon, Gino and Fred.Stacey Solomon - " alt"Penarth Times: Stacey Solomon is a regular on ITVs Loose Women. Scarlett rose to fame after appearing with her family on Channel rsquos hit show Gogglebox and proved a hit with ITV viewers after being crowned queen of the jungle.He appearance on the show impressed host Ant and Dec s much that she was invited to co-host Ant  Decrsquos Saturday Night Takeaway. She also co hosted spin-off show Extra Camp during the following season.Georgia lsquoToffrsquo Toffolo ndash " alt"Penarth Times: lsquoToffrsquo rose to fame after appearing in Ersquos reality series Made in Cha. Being able to buy them online has also helped to boost their must-have status. title: bbc think singer pixie lott descended musicians
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. lineage to histwo-times great-grandfathers le as a chimney sweep and Naval officer.Catch the next episode of #WDYTYA tomorrow night, featuring singer @PixieLott. pm Tuesday on @BBCOne. pic QbKjETZmdash WDYTYA  UKNovember , In tonights episode, viewers will see Pixie Lott uncover the truth amid the rumours of her ancestry.Going into her investigation, the singer had believed that her grandfather was from Verona, in Italy.Pixiehad been telling people for years that her family was from the Romeo and Juliet town and that she was, therefore, part Italian.However, it becomes clear fairly early on that this is not the case but she quickly brushes away her disappointment when she learns that she is descended from musicians.Pixie Lotts musical rootsPixie found three generations of musicians on her motherrsquos side of the family during her genealogy journey.Speaking about making the programme, she said: ldquoI was extremely happy to find I have musicians in the family.ldquoI always thought I was the only one to do music as an occupation.ldquoIt makes more sense now as to why I went into it myself.The singer added: ldquoIt was a once in a letime journey to go on, especially as my mum joined us too.ldquoNow we can pass the stories on to the next generation from our family and keep them alive.Pixie also makes some other incredible discoveries about herpaternal title: remembrance day poem read remembrance day services
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAct or Remembrance will take place up and down the country on November .The Last Post will sound and be followed by a two-minute silence, as we remember all those lost in conflict.The end of the silence will be marked by the Reveille.Before the Act of Remembrance though, The Ode will be read.But what is The Ode We will remember themlsquoThe Odersquo ndash as it is commonly known ndash is taken from a poem written by the English poet Laurence Binyon.It was first published in The Times on September , , and has been recited at commemorative services since .The Ode is the fourth verse of Binyonrsquos poem For the Fallen.It reads:"They shall grow not old, as we that are left grow old"Age shall not weary them, nor the years condemn."At the going down of the sun and in the morning"We will remember them."For the FallenThis is For the Fallen, by Lawrence Binyon in full:With proud thanksgiving, a mother for her children,England mourns for her dead across the sea.Flesh of her flesh they were, spirit of her spirit,Fallen in the cause of the free.Solemn the drums thrill: Death august and royalSings sorrow up into immortal spheres.There is music in the midst of desolationAnd a glory that shines upon our tears.They went with songs to the battle, they were young,Straight of limb, true of eye, steady and aglow.They were staunch to the end against odds uncounted,They fell with their faces to the foe.They shall grow not old, as we that are left grow oldAge shall not weary them, nor the years condemn.At the going down of the sun and in the morningWe will remember them.They mingle not with their laughing comrades againThey sit no more at familiar tables at homeThey have no lot in our labour of the day-time.removeThey sleep beyond Englands foam.But where our desires are and our hopes profound,Felt as a well-spring that is hidden from sight,To the innermost heart of their own land they are knownAs the stars are known to the NightAs the stars that shall be bright when we are dust,Moving in marches upon the heavenly plain,As the stars that are starry in the time of our darkness,To the end, to the end, they remain. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey story: Building firms from across NI offer jobs after JMC Mechanical and Construction Ltd, goes into liquidation   Number of COVID patients in Craigavon Hospital doubles in two weeksNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPeoplePortadown school contacts PSNI after TikTok accounts aimed at humiliating teachers condemnedA Portadown school said it is aware of a number of TikTok accounts aimed at humiliating staff and some pupils.By Carmel RobinsonMonday, th November , : pm  "       "  Killicomaine Junior High School described the behaviour as ‘completely unacceptable’ and has informed the PSNI. Some of the videos share photos of teachers aiming to ‘rate them’.Thousands of people have viewed these videos which have been described as ‘unpleasant’." title: mike nesbitt joins calls for apology over mlas sectarian ruc comments
story: Craigavon men facing charges of aggravated burglary after pensioner was confronted in his Tandragee home   Road repairs branded ‘diabolical’NewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessFree Happy AdsNewsPoliticsMike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC commentsA row over an MLA’s claim the RUC represented “institutionalised sectarianism” has escalated with Mike Nesbitt joining calls for Dolores Kelly to apologise.By Mark RaineyFriday, th November , : pm  "       "  RUC officer at the scene of a terrorist atrocity in Belfast city centre in . Photo: PacemakerUpper Bann MLA Mrs Kelly was quoted in a newspaper article as saying this week’s PSNI th anniversary was the perfect opportunity to recommit to the principle of a shared police force. The SDLP policing board member also said the creation of the PSNI was a “signicant departure from the institutionalised sectarianism represented by the RUC”.Those comments led to the NI Retired Police Officers’ Association penning an open letter to Mrs Kelly, in which the NIRPOA chairman called on the MLA to withdraw her remarks, and to apologise for the “gross offence” caused.The letter states: “I am writing to seek your immediate withdrawal of that remark, and an apology for the gross offence you have caused to the thousands of members of the Royal Ulster Constabulary GC who served this community in the most challenging of times.”Mrs Kelly responded, saying: “The SDLP has previously paid tribute to the sacrices made by many RUC officers and their families.“The fact remains that there were severe institutional problems within the RUC and this is a matter of public record. That many retired police officers continue to refuse to cooperate with legacy investigations to this day speaks for itself.”Mrs Kelly added: “The transformation of the RUC to the PSNI has been an outstanding success and whilst policing continues to be challenging I think the hard work and efforts of the those involved in implementing Patten’s recommendations deserve credit.”Ulster Unionist policing board member Mr Nesbitt said he believes his SDLP counterpart should “reflect on her comments and the hurt they have caused and apologise”.He said: “The RUC were the barrier between Northern Ireland and complete anarchy. They bravely held the line throughout the Troubles.“Dolores Kelly’s comments have caused great hurt to former officers, their families and friends. Police officers didn’t wake up hoping to hurt someone, but every terrorist did, and it was police officers who were targeted simply because they were trying to protect society and save lives”.Mr Nesbitt added: “Nobody disputes that the RUC could have done with more Catholic officers within its ranks.“I have no doubt that many more would have come forward had it not been for the fact that the IRA made a special effort to target those Catholics who did join the RUC”.Mike NesbittPSNI  "       "  Most PopularPortadown school contacts PSNI after TikTok accounts aimed at humiliating teachers condemnedNumber of COVID patients in Craigavon Hospital doubles in two weeksMan lost consciousness after being struck from behind in Lurgan attackCraigavon men facing charges of aggravated burglary after pensioner was confronted in his Tandragee homeTeenage boy stabbed at Halloween Fireworks Display in CraigavonMost PopularMike Nesbitt joins calls for apology over MLA’s ‘sectarian’ RUC commentsMan and woman arrested after woman seriously injured in CraigavonHalloween hooligans’ rampage in Lurgan ‘terried’ residentsPortadown murder: Shock in rural community after man arrested on suspicion of murderBuilding firms from across NI offer jobs after JMC Mechanical and Construction Ltd, goes into liquidation                       This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us on    ExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter " fill"#ea"  ©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-dqBHgY sc-gxMtzJ bAegnq"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyModern Slavery Statement  News you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""  " "  "  scale translate " points"  .  . title: top tips for safe student accommodation
story: With freshers week around the corner and thousands of young people in Northern Ireland set to start University or new career paths, many will be on the hunt for rented accommodation. Northern Ireland has experienced a .% increase in average rental values this year[]. With the price increase, OFTEC, representing the liquid fuel industry in Ireland, is concerned that students may take cheaper accommodation options without properly inspecting the property. With this in mind, OFTEC has issued advise to help students ensure their accommodation is safe before they sign the dotted line. Raise the alarm – Currently, it is not a mandatory requirement for private landlords to provide smoke and carbon monoxide detectors, but the HSENI recommend that they do. It is a legal requirement to fit a carbon monoxide detector when a fossil fuel appliance has been replaced. Carbon monoxide is potentially lethal as it has no smell, taste or colour. Without a working alarm, it is impossible to identy carbon monoxide leaks. OFTEC’s advise is to ensure that there are working fire and CO alarms in the property, and that they are tested on a regular basis.Heating requirements - The Health  Safety Executive recommend that all boilers should be serviced annually and tenants should ask for evidence of recent servicing. If you have concerns, ask for a CD  Landlord Oil Installation Check which is carried out by an OFTEC registered technician and will give you peace of mind. For a gas heated property, ask for a copy of the annual gas safety check.Look for damp – It is easy to hide damp patches with a coat of paint, soyour house smells musty or you see evidence of mould, find out how the landlord is planning to fix the problem. Mould has no place in the home as it can cause respiratory problems and headaches.Furniture and fittings – Ask the landlord for a list of everything that is included and make note of any damage that is there before you move it. Check any beds, sofas and chairs are in good condition.Secure your home – burglars may target student areas because of lax security. Ask your landlord to fit key operating locks on the windows and lever deadlocks on external doors.  OFTEC Ireland Manager, David Blevings, said: “Quite often the excitement of moving in with friends can overshadow the concerns about the accommodation itself. We are urging students to play it safe this year and carry out these essential checks before signing a lease and moving in. “Asking a landlord about safety may seem awkward, but it could prevent you from living in a potentially dangerous property for the next  months. It’s vital that your new home is not a burden as you start your time at university. To find your nearest registered technician visit www.oftec.org  addthis,     Leave your commentTyrone Constitution- High Street, OmaghBT BDTel:     , ,, , ,  .jsp, , ,   , ,success:  ,  n n nHome n n
